alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 02 at 1:50PM MST until March 03 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 11 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 MPH. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...From 5 AM to 11 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. Cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
